item.title: Price Index: The Future Of Bitcoin Lies In The Hands Of Developers
item.description:
Price Index: The Future Of Bitcoin Lies In The Hands Of Developers

What started out as just Shaun Gilchrist's hobby is developing to become the world's first and premier price index for Bitcoin, BitcoinAverage. Basic physics describes how a simple innocent bathtub immersion inspired an innovation that has affected mankind. Archimedes did not set out to discover the principle of floatation, but ships are built today based on the principles he discovered.

item.title: Bitcoin Price Support and Resistance
item.description:
Bitcoin Price Support and Resistance

Bitcoin price will make many people rich this year. The bullish prospects are self-evident and a steady parabolic advance, some time this year, will give bitcoin traders what they want. Bitcoin price waves, like all market charts, advance and decline between established support and resistance zones.

item.title: The Africoin Report: Shopping Online with Bitcoin Gets Better
item.description:
The Africoin Report: Shopping Online with Bitcoin Gets Better

Last October, I wrote an article about "Why Bitcoin Is Perfect for Libya." Nothing has changed since then. My country doesn't offer much support when it comes to online payments. We don't have Paypal (legally at least) and getting credit cards is hard, banking Is nightmare, etc.

item.title: Ukraine Bitcoin License Plans Have Been Put On Ice
item.description:
Ukraine Bitcoin License Plans Have Been Put On Ice

Various countries around the world are contemplating whether or not they have to undertake additional action to regulate Bitcoin and cryptocurrency. Until very recently, Ukraine had a Bitcoin License proposal, but that has been killed off very recently.

item.title: Opposition to bitcoin isn't unique. We've seen this before - with a happy ending
item.description:
Opposition to bitcoin isn't unique. We've seen this before - with a happy ending

Over the weekend, I found myself watching " Tesla: Master of Lightning," a PBS production streaming on Netflix. From the story of Nikola Tesla, I saw parallels between his invention, alternating current (AC), and what bitcoin has been experiencing for some time now. On June 6, 1884, Tesla arrived in New York.

item.title: Media Fails In Attempt To Destroy Bitcoin In Favor Of Blockchain
item.description:
Media Fails In Attempt To Destroy Bitcoin In Favor Of Blockchain

Blockchain is a hot term right now, and every company and their dog seems to be working on some type of project involving this technology. Mainstream media is having a field day as of late by referring to blockchain every time they want to make a mention of companies involved in Bitcoin and cryptocurrency.

item.title: Five Ways People Actively Promote Bitcoin
item.description:
Five Ways People Actively Promote Bitcoin

Promoting Bitcoin and cryptocurrency is not an easy task these days, but there are some interesting ideas to be found all over the world. The Great Canadian Water Co. has come up with a mockup design for Bitcoin water bottles. In fact, they will be sold for Bitcoin if there is enough demand to produce these labels.

item.title: From Remittance to Startups, How Bitcoin Is Used in Africa
item.description:
From Remittance to Startups, How Bitcoin Is Used in Africa

With the high mobile phone penetration already in place, Africa is set to enable more users to download a Bitcoin wallet on their devices. In an email last year, Werner van Rooyen from Bitx, one of Africa's biggest Bitcoin exchange firms, wrote that Africa has been waiting for something like Bitcoin for a long time.

item.title: Bitcoin's Messy Push for Innovation is Winning Over Payments Innovators - CoinDesk
item.description:
Bitcoin's Messy Push for Innovation is Winning Over Payments Innovators - CoinDesk

A recent dispute within the W3C's Web Payments groups has given skeptics of bitcoin's sometimes chaotic development process "cause for pause" when thinking about the best way to deploy new financial technology.
